intro: Franciscea uniflora, commonly known as the single-flower franciscea, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage and a single, showy flower that blooms in late spring or early summer. It typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils in coastal and mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
